title: SEC Charges StraightPath With Fraud Tied to Pre-IPO Stocks
sub_head: The agency alleges the firm made ‘Ponzi scheme-like payments’ with $410 million of investor cash
body:
A self-described “boutique private equity firm” and four people who allegedly ran it face civil fraud allegations from the Securities and Exchange Commission over the handling of more than $410 million raised from at least 2,200 investors, court documents show.
StraightPath Venture Partners LLC, now based in Jupiter, Fla., allegedly made “Ponzi scheme-like payments” to cover transactions and distributions from the commingled assets across nine funds that the firm said would be used to acquire equity shares in private companies at the pre-initial public offering stage, the SEC said.
